channel.title: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?
channel.description: I am behind two routers one that my isp has control over and won't let me have administrative access to is there any way I would be able to host from my computer without port forwarding?

item.title: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

I think utorrent changed pretty sure you can’t port via it any longer

Read full topic
item.source: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?

item.title: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:525658”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=644399.msg4337744#msg4337744 date=1374648621]

uTorrent should work.
Also, you can try Hamachi…

And you can always try calling your ISP about opening that port.
[/quote]what exactly does utorrent do, then?

It does use upnp but typically people use it to port forward because of this very reason…[/quote]I assumed that by ‘no administrative access’ he really meant no administrative access at all. So yeah maybe upnp is worth a try…

Read full topic

item.title: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Not without a relay (ie, a vps/server that tunnels to your computer). At which point you might as well just host on the server. So no

item.title: Behind two routers, possibility for hosting?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Your best bet is to buy a VPS if you have enough money because players will not want to download a program just to connect to your server.
